lv.emes.libraries.communication.tcp_ip.server

Class MS_TcpIPServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • lv.emes.libraries.communication.tcp_ip.MS_TcpIPAbstract
      • lv.emes.libraries.communication.tcp_ip.server.MS_TcpIPServer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class MS_TcpIPServer
extends MS_TcpIPAbstract
    TCP/IP server which operates commands to communicate to client.

    Public methods: -registerNewCommand -getCommandList -addDataToContainer -cmdToClientByID -cmdToClient -cmdToAll -startServer -stopServer -isRunning -getIsActive -setPort -getPort -getClients -getClientByID -disconnectClientByID

    Public properties to set: -onClientConnecting -onClientGoingOffline -onClientSayingHi

    Protected methods: -onIncomingClientMessage -onNewClientConnected -writeln

    Version:
    1.2.
    Author:
    eMeS

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      boolean notifyClientsOnDC
      If true, all clients will be notified that server is going down when stopServer is called.
      IFuncOnClientDoingSomething onClientConnecting
      Set this property with lambda expression to do actions after client successfully connected to server.
      IFuncOnClientDoingSomething onClientGoingOffline
      Set this property with lambda expression to do actions after client went down (disconnected).
      IFuncOnClientDoingSomething onClientSayingHi
      Right after successful connection client is sending something like "Hi" message that introduces him.

      void cmdToAll(java.lang.String cmdCode)
      Use this method to send custom command to every single connected client! This method works silently and don't throw any exceptions if something bad happens, but it tries to send messages to every single client even if IOException happens in the middle of list.

    • Field Detail

      • onClientGoingOffline

        public IFuncOnClientDoingSomething onClientGoingOffline
        Set this property with lambda expression to do actions after client went down (disconnected).
        Note: communication with this client is already impossible at this moment.
        (client) -> {};

      • onClientConnecting

        public IFuncOnClientDoingSomething onClientConnecting
        Set this property with lambda expression to do actions after client successfully connected to server.
        (client) -> {};

      • onClientSayingHi

        public IFuncOnClientDoingSomething onClientSayingHi
        Right after successful connection client is sending something like "Hi" message that introduces him. Client also sends data about his device: OS name, system user name, path to working directory and path to home directory.

      • notifyClientsOnDC

        public boolean notifyClientsOnDC
        If true, all clients will be notified that server is going down when stopServer is called. Default: true.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MS_TcpIPServer

        public MS_TcpIPServer(int port)
        Creates new server instance and sets its port.
        Parameters:
        port - 1..~65k.

    • Method Detail

      • registerNewCommand

        public void registerNewCommand(MS_ServerCommand cmd)
        Adds new command to command list. Commands are recognized by code. All commands must be unique. Commands cannot be deleted, except by clearing command list. If client sends particular command to server, server acts just as command's implementation asks.
        Parameters:
        cmd - command code and method which will be triggered when client sends particular command.

      • getCommandList

        public MS_List<MS_ServerCommand> getCommandList()
        That is recommended not to use this variable. Use only if really necessary to do manual changes in list of registered commands.
        Returns:
        List of all registered commands.
        See Also:
        registerNewCommand(lv.emes.libraries.communication.tcp_ip.server.MS_ServerCommand)

      • getCommandByCode

        public MS_ServerCommand getCommandByCode(java.lang.String cmdCode)
        Tries to find command in registered command list.
        Parameters:
        cmdCode - code of command.
        Returns:
        MS_ServerCommand or null if command doesn't exist in registered command list.

      • cmdToClientByID

        public boolean cmdToClientByID(java.lang.String cmdCode,
                               int clientID)
        Use this method to send custom command to particular client by his ID! If some data added with addDataToContainer, those will also be sent by this message.

        Data is simply string list with index starting with 1, cause 0 is for cmdCode. Data container is cleared after this method in every case.

        Parameters:
        cmdCode - command ID.
        clientID - id of addressee.
        Returns:
        false if error occurred during sending message.
        See Also:
        MS_TcpIPAbstract.addDataToContainer(java.lang.String)

      • cmdToClient

        public boolean cmdToClient(java.lang.String cmdCode,
                           MS_ClientOfServer client)
        Use this method to send custom command to particular client! If some data added with addDataToContainer, those will also be sent by this message.

        Data is simply string list with index starting with 1, cause 0 is for cmdCode. Data container is cleared after this method in every case.

        Parameters:
        cmdCode - command ID.
        client - addressee itself.
        Returns:
        false if error occurred during sending message.
        See Also:
        MS_TcpIPAbstract.addDataToContainer(java.lang.String)

      • cmdToAll

        public void cmdToAll(java.lang.String cmdCode)
        Use this method to send custom command to every single connected client! This method works silently and don't throw any exceptions if something bad happens, but it tries to send messages to every single client even if IOException happens in the middle of list.

        If some data added with addDataToContainer, those will also be sent by this message.

        Data is simply string list with index starting with 1, cause 0 is for cmdCode. Data container is cleared after this method.

        Parameters:
        cmdCode - command ID.
        See Also:
        MS_TcpIPAbstract.addDataToContainer(java.lang.String)

      • stopServer

        public void stopServer()
        Stops server for listening. And notifies all connected clients that server is shutting down with command DC_NOTIFY_MESSAGE which is first command in commandList of client objects.

        To disable this option change notifyClientsOnDC to false or simply remove 0-th element in commandList of all client objects (MS_TcpClient), which is not recommended.

      • getIsActive

        public boolean getIsActive()
        Synonym for isRunning.
        Specified by:
        getIsActive in class MS_TcpIPAbstract
        Returns:
        whether server is ready for message exchange or not.

      • setPort

        public void setPort(int portNumber)
        Changes port in which server will be listening. If this will be done when server is already launched, this will do no effect. You should change this property only before method startServer.
        Parameters:
        portNumber - particular port number (1..65k)

      • getPort

        public int getPort()

      • startServer

        public void startServer()
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                        java.io.IOException
        Starts server at defined port. New thread is created and server starts listening for incoming client connections.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if server invalid port defined during creation of server object.
        java.io.IOException - if server cannot be started due to an I/O error when opening the socket.

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning()
        Gets information about server online status.
        Returns:
        true if server is running; false, if it's down.

      • run

        public void run()
        This will listen for new client connections and creates new thread for every connected client.

      • getClients

        public java.util.Vector<MS_ClientOfServer> getClients()
        Returns:
        all the connected clients.

      • disconnectClientByID

        public void disconnectClientByID(int clientId)
        Disconnects particular client. Also removes client from clients list.
        Parameters:
        clientId - id of client.

      • disconnectAllClients

        public void disconnectAllClients()
        Disconnects all clients. Also removes clients from clients list. Server is still running after execution of this method.

      • getClientByID

        public MS_ClientOfServer getClientByID(int clientId)
        Goes through the list of connected clients and seeks for particular client.
        Parameters:
        clientId - id (starting with 1) of client to look for.
        Returns:
        MS_ClientOfServer if client found; otherwise returns null.
